formattedAddress: 9 Pell St, New York, NY 10013, USA
adrFormatAddress: 9 Pell St, New York, NY 10013, USA

originalText.text:
New restaurant on Pell St. Spacious inside with lots of tables. We came here on a Friday afternoon and were the only ones here. Ordered the Malaysian Chow Fun, Combo #18 (Curry Combination on Rice) and Combo #19 (Homestyle Combination on Rice). All three were good and flavorful. The beef stew that came with both of the combos were very good; tender and flavorful. We liked the Malaysian Chow Fun so much that we ordered one to go.

They accept credit cards here, however, there was a sign that the minimum was $20 to credit cards which is a bit high. Most places have minimum of $10.

originalText.text: Nice spot on Pell St.  Hainanese chicken was pretty good, the Sambal Beef was flavorful but the larger cuts of meat were tough. The Japanese Tofu was very nice but the favorite was the Herbal soup, very rich. It was also good to see overflowing bowls of rice.  The chicken rice was delicious.

text.text: Nice spot on Pell St.  Hainanese chicken was pretty good, the Sambal Beef was flavorful but the larger cuts of meat were tough. The Japanese Tofu was very nice but the favorite was the Herbal soup, very rich. It was also good to see overflowing bowls of rice.  The chicken rice was delicious.

originalText.text: I really want to like this place ! I really do ! The food was okay to me. The biggest turn off was we had the noodle dish and we order two of them. The noodles were super soft and soggy.  We told the waiter and they didn’t even offer a refund which was upsetting. I wouldn’t go back again for that. The dishes were okay. We had some apps and everyone order their own dishes. We had chicken and beef curry with rice. We had wings, roti and squid as apps. We had the noodle tofu curry soup.

text.text: I really want to like this place ! I really do ! The food was okay to me. The biggest turn off was we had the noodle dish and we order two of them. The noodles were super soft and soggy.  We told the waiter and they didn’t even offer a refund which was upsetting. I wouldn’t go back again for that. The dishes were okay. We had some apps and everyone order their own dishes. We had chicken and beef curry with rice. We had wings, roti and squid as apps. We had the noodle tofu curry soup.

originalText.text:
The food was delicious and came quickly. We started with the chicken satay which was covered in a delicious sauce, it was hands down the best I've ever had. The sauce was so good we ended up eating the cucumber and red onion it was served in just to eat all the sauce.

For mains my friend got the curry chicken over rice and the chicken was so tender it fell right off the bone. I got the Curry Asam with Swordfish, the amount of fish was astounding for the price. The curry was so delicious, I've never had curry Asam before but I would definitely recommend the dish to anyone who enjoys fish. I can't wait to reheat the leftovers!

I will be coming back

originalText.text: Newly opened Malaysian and Thai cuisine place. Very spacious, love this part. The food portion is big and can be shared with two people but we Asians always share food anyway. Food came out fast, they even gave the pickled peppers and belacan chili to the table without us asking, love this part as well. We loved the food we ordered - Egg and pork chow fun, Penang kueh teow with flat noodle (already spicy, not to me tho), and asam laksa (not for everyone coz of the shrimp paste taste and it's spicy and sour type of food). They take credit cards. Overall experience was good. Will be going back to try other dishes.
